com.solacesystems.jcsmp

Class JCSMPGlobalProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.solacesystems.jcsmp.JCSMPGlobalProperties
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable

    public class JCSMPGlobalProperties
extends Object
implements Cloneable, Serializable
    This class exposes tunable settings for some of the Messaging API's internal functionality. A JCSMPGlobalProperties instance, once populated, must be set on JCSMPFactory, as in the following example: 
     JCSMPGlobalProperties gp = new JCSMPGlobalProperties();
 // override default properties
 gp.setConsumerDispatcherQueueSize(10000);
 JCSMPFactory.onlyInstance().setGlobalProperties(gp);

    Global properties may only be set before any sessions have been created from the JCSMPFactory.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getProducerDispatcherQueueSize

        The size of the producer notification dispatcher queue.

      • setProducerDispatcherQueueSize

        public void setProducerDispatcherQueueSize(int producerDispatcherQueueSize)
        Sets the size of the producer notification dispatcher queue. (The default is 2000 elements.)

        The producer notification dispatcher queue is used by the API to notify streaming producers of message acknowledgements and message publishing exceptions through their JCSMPStreamingPublishCorrelatingEventHandler. Internal API threads append notifications to the queue, blocking, if necessary, until space is available. There is one such queue per Context.

        Parameters:
        producerDispatcherQueueSize - The queue size.

      • getConsumerDispatcherQueueSize

        public int getConsumerDispatcherQueueSize()
        Gets the size of the consumer notification dispatcher queue.
        Returns:
        The size of the consumer notification dispatcher queue.
        See Also:
        setConsumerDispatcherQueueSize(int)

      • setConsumerDispatcherQueueSize

        public void setConsumerDispatcherQueueSize(int consumerDispatcherQueueSize)
        Sets the size of the consumer notification dispatcher queue. (The default is 75000 elements.)

        The API uses the consumer notification dispatcher queue to notify asynchronous consumers of messages and exceptions through their XMLMessageListener. Internal API threads append notifications to the queue, blocking if necessary until space is available. There is one such queue per Context.

        Best Practices

        The API allocates a thread to service this queue and dispatch notifications to an application's XMLMessageListeners. If an XMLMessageListener does not always return control quickly and the notification queue fills up, then other API threads can become blocked when attempting to enqueue notifications to this queue.

        To avoid this possibility, applications should ensure this queue is large enough to buffer the maximum number of notifications that can be generated by all consumer flows (guaranteed flows as well as direct consumers) contained in all sessions in a Context, i.e., 

            queueSize > Σ (f.windowSize) + (FCL * Nconsumers)
               f ∈ GDFlows
        Where 
            GDFlows  : Set of all guaranteed delivery consumer flows in a Context
    FCL      : Default consumer flow congestion limit
    Nconsumers: Number of direct consumers in a Context
        Parameters:
        consumerDispatcherQueueSize - queue size

      • getConsumerDefaultFlowCongestionLimit

        public int getConsumerDefaultFlowCongestionLimit()
        Gets the default consumer's congestion limit.
        Returns:
        The congestion limit for the default consumer.
        See Also:
        setConsumerDefaultFlowCongestionLimit(int)

      • setConsumerDefaultFlowCongestionLimit

        public void setConsumerDefaultFlowCongestionLimit(int consumerDefaultFlowCongestionLimit)
        Sets the the default consumer's congestion limit. (The default is 5000 elements.)

        If a JCSMPXMLMessageConsumer accumulates more than this number of messages not yet handled by the consuming application, it will temporarily suspend reading from the underlying TCP connection.

        Parameters:
        consumerDefaultFlowCongestionLimit - The new congestion limit to set.

      • getConsumerDefaultFlowUncongestedLimit

        public int getConsumerDefaultFlowUncongestedLimit()
        Gets the default consumer's uncongested threshold (calculated as 0.2 * getConsumerDefaultFlowCongestionLimit()).
        Returns:
        The uncongested threshold for the default consumer.

      • getReconnectFreqManagerMaxReconnects

        public int getReconnectFreqManagerMaxReconnects()
        Gets the maximum number of reconnects to allow before the reconnect frequency manager kills a connection.
        Returns:
        The maximum number of reconnects to allow before killing a connection.
        See Also:
        setReconnectFreqManagerMaxReconnects(int)

      • setReconnectFreqManagerMaxReconnects

        public void setReconnectFreqManagerMaxReconnects(int reconnectFreqManagerMaxReconnects)
        Sets the maximum number of reconnects to allow before the reconnect frequency manager kills a connection. (The default is 10.)

        To prevent competing clients with the same name kicking each other out from the appliance indefinitely, the Messaging API kills connections when they reconnect too fast to the appliance. This is normally due to a misconfiguration of application connection and authentication parameters.

        The threshold is the configured number of reconnections allowed in a four second period. If this number is exceeded, the connection is closed.

        Parameters:
        reconnectFreqManagerMaxReconnects - Maximum number of reconnections to allow in a four second period.

      • shouldDropInternalReplyMessages

        public static boolean shouldDropInternalReplyMessages()
        Only used by the SolJMS API to allow JMS clients to participate in the request/reply protocol interaction with other client APIs using the direct messaging domain.

        If shouldDropInternalReplyMessages is set to true (the default), JCMSP will drop the message if it has the following conditions: 1- Correlation ID starting with #REQ or #CRQ 2- the isRelplyMesssage field is set to true If shouldDropInternalReplyMessages is set to false, no reply messages will be dropped

        [SolReserved]
        Returns:
        result
